Rust Full-Stack Guide

Build high-performance full-stack applications with PhilJS and Rust using Axum, WASM, and server functions.

Overview

PhilJS offers first-class Rust support, allowing you to build entire full-stack applications in Rust. This guide covers everything from setup to deployment.

What You'll Learn

  • Setting up a Rust + PhilJS project
  • Using the view! macro for type-safe components
  • Creating server functions with Axum
  • Database integration with SeaORM
  • Building and deploying WASM applications
  • Server-side rendering in Rust

Prerequisites

Terminal
$rustup --version
$cargo --version
i

Rust Version

PhilJS requires Rust 1.75 or later. Update with rustup update stable.

Installation

Install the PhilJS cargo extension:

Terminal
$cargo install cargo-philjs
$cargo philjs new fullstack-app
$cd fullstack-app

This creates a new project with the following structure:

1fullstack-app/
2├── Cargo.toml
3├── src/
4│   ├── main.rs           # Server entry point
5│   ├── app.rs            # Root component
6│   ├── components/       # UI components
7│   ├── server/           # Server functions
8│   └── lib.rs            # Shared code
9├── static/               # Static assets
10└── migrations/           # Database migrations

The view! Macro

PhilJS provides a powerful view! macro for building UI in Rust:

src/app.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4pub fn App() -> impl IntoView {
5    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(0);
6 
7    view! {
8        <div class="app">
9            <h1>"Counter: " {count}</h1>
10            <button on:click=move |_| set_count.update(|n| *n + 1)>
11                "Increment"
12            </button>
13        </div>
14    }
15}
16 
17fn main() {
18    philjs::mount_to_body(App);
19}
✓

Type Safety

The view! macro is fully type-checked at compile time. Typos and type errors are caught before your code even runs!

Creating Components

src/components/todo_item.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4pub fn TodoItem(
5    #[prop] todo: Todo,
6    #[prop] on_toggle: Callback<String>,
7    #[prop] on_delete: Callback<String>,
8) -> impl IntoView {
9    view! {
10        <li class:completed={todo.completed}>
11            <input
12                type="checkbox"
13                checked={todo.completed}
14                on:change=move |_| on_toggle.call(todo.id.clone())
15            />
16            <span>{&todo.text}</span>
17            <button on:click=move |_| on_delete.call(todo.id.clone())>
18                "Delete"
19            </button>
20        </li>
21    }
22}
23 
24#[derive(Clone, PartialEq)]
25pub struct Todo {
26    pub id: String,
27    pub text: String,
28    pub completed: bool,
29}

Server Functions

Server functions let you call server-side code from the client seamlessly:

src/server/todos.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
3 
4#[derive(Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
5pub struct Todo {
6    pub id: String,
7    pub text: String,
8    pub completed: bool,
9}
10 
11// Server function - runs only on the server
12#[server(GetTodos, "/api")]
13pub async fn get_todos() -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
14    use crate::db;
15 
16    let todos = db::get_all_todos().await?;
17    Ok(todos)
18}
19 
20#[server(CreateTodo, "/api")]
21pub async fn create_todo(text: String) -> Result<Todo, ServerFnError> {
22    use crate::db;
23 
24    let todo = db::create_todo(text).await?;
25    Ok(todo)
26}
27 
28#[server(ToggleTodo, "/api")]
29pub async fn toggle_todo(id: String) -> Result<(), ServerFnError> {
30    use crate::db;
31 
32    db::toggle_todo(&id).await?;
33    Ok(())
34}
35 
36// Client-side usage
37#[component]
38pub fn TodoList() -> impl IntoView {
39    let todos = create_resource(|| (), |_| async { get_todos().await });
40 
41    let create = create_action(|text: &String| {
42        let text = text.clone();
43        async move { create_todo(text).await }
44    });
45 
46    view! {
47        <div>
48            <Suspense fallback=|| view! { <p>"Loading..."</p> }>
49                {move || todos.get().map(|result| match result {
50                    Ok(todos) => view! {
51                        <ul>
52                            <For
53                                each=move || todos.clone()
54                                key=|todo| todo.id.clone()
55                                let:todo
56                            >
57                                <TodoItem todo={todo}/>
58                            </For>
59                        </ul>
60                    }.into_view(),
61                    Err(e) => view! { <p>"Error: " {e.to_string()}</p> }.into_view(),
62                })}
63            </Suspense>
64        </div>
65    }
66}

Axum Integration

PhilJS integrates seamlessly with Axum for the server:

src/main.rsrust
1use axum::{
2    routing::{get, post},
3    Router,
4};
5use philjs_axum::{generate_route_list, PhilJsRoutes};
6use tower_http::services::ServeDir;
7 
8mod app;
9mod server;
10 
11#[tokio::main]
12async fn main() {
13    // Generate routes from PhilJS app
14    let conf = philjs::get_configuration(None).await.unwrap();
15    let philjs_routes = generate_route_list(app::App);
16 
17    let app = Router::new()
18        // Serve static files
19        .nest_service("/static", ServeDir::new("static"))
20        // API routes
21        .route("/api/todos", get(server::get_todos))
22        .route("/api/todos", post(server::create_todo))
23        // PhilJS SSR routes
24        .philjs_routes(&philjs_routes, app::App)
25        // Fallback to PhilJS router
26        .fallback(philjs_axum::render_app_async(
27            philjs_routes.clone(),
28            app::App,
29        ));
30 
31    println!("Listening on http://127.0.0.1:3000");
32    let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind("127.0.0.1:3000")
33        .await
34        .unwrap();
35 
36    axum::serve(listener, app).await.unwrap();
37}

Database Integration with SeaORM

src/db/todos.rsrust
1use sea_orm::*;
2use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
3 
4#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, DeriveEntityModel, Serialize, Deserialize)]
5#[sea_orm(table_name = "todos")]
6pub struct Model {
7    #[sea_orm(primary_key, auto_increment = false)]
8    pub id: String,
9    pub text: String,
10    pub completed: bool,
11    pub created_at: DateTimeUtc,
12}
13 
14#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug, EnumIter, DeriveRelation)]
15pub enum Relation {}
16 
17impl ActiveModelBehavior for ActiveModel {}
18 
19// Database operations
20pub async fn get_all_todos(db: &DatabaseConnection) -> Result<Vec<Model>, DbErr> {
21    Entity::find()
22        .order_by_desc(Column::CreatedAt)
23        .all(db)
24        .await
25}
26 
27pub async fn create_todo(
28    db: &DatabaseConnection,
29    text: String,
30) -> Result<Model, DbErr> {
31    let todo = ActiveModel {
32        id: Set(uuid::Uuid::new_v4().to_string()),
33        text: Set(text),
34        completed: Set(false),
35        created_at: Set(chrono::Utc::now()),
36    };
37 
38    todo.insert(db).await
39}
40 
41pub async fn toggle_todo(
42    db: &DatabaseConnection,
43    id: &str,
44) -> Result<Model, DbErr> {
45    let todo = Entity::find_by_id(id).one(db).await?;
46 
47    if let Some(todo) = todo {
48        let mut todo: ActiveModel = todo.into();
49        todo.completed = Set(!todo.completed.unwrap());
50        todo.update(db).await
51    } else {
52        Err(DbErr::RecordNotFound(id.to_string()))
53    }
54}

Global State Management

src/state.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use std::rc::Rc;
3 
4#[derive(Clone)]
5pub struct AppState {
6    pub user: RwSignal<Option<User>>,
7    pub theme: RwSignal<Theme>,
8}
9 
10impl AppState {
11    pub fn new() -> Self {
12        Self {
13            user: create_rw_signal(None),
14            theme: create_rw_signal(Theme::Light),
15        }
16    }
17}
18 
19#[component]
20pub fn App() -> impl IntoView {
21    let state = AppState::new();
22    provide_context(state.clone());
23 
24    view! {
25        <Router>
26            <Routes>
27                <Route path="/" view=Home/>
28                <Route path="/profile" view=Profile/>
29            </Routes>
30        </Router>
31    }
32}
33 
34// Use in child components
35#[component]
36pub fn Profile() -> impl IntoView {
37    let state = use_context::<AppState>()
38        .expect("AppState context missing");
39 
40    view! {
41        <Show
42            when=move || state.user.get().is_some()
43            fallback=|| view! { <p>"Please log in"</p> }
44        >
45            {move || {
46                let user = state.user.get().unwrap();
47                view! {
48                    <div>
49                        <h1>{&user.name}</h1>
50                        <p>{&user.email}</p>
51                    </div>
52                }
53            }}
54        </Show>
55    }
56}

Building for WASM

Compile your PhilJS Rust app to WebAssembly:

Terminal
$cargo philjs build --release
$cargo philjs serve

The build process:

  1. Compiles Rust code to WASM
  2. Generates JavaScript bindings
  3. Optimizes WASM binary with wasm-opt
  4. Bundles with your static assets
i

Bundle Size

PhilJS Rust apps compile to small WASM bundles (typically 50-150KB gzipped) with excellent performance characteristics.

Deployment

Docker Deployment

Dockerfiledockerfile
1FROM rust:1.75 as builder
2WORKDIR /app
3COPY . .
4RUN cargo install cargo-philjs
5RUN cargo philjs build --release
6 
7FROM debian:bookworm-slim
8RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y ca-certificates && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
9COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/fullstack-app /usr/local/bin/
10COPY --from=builder /app/static /app/static
11 
12ENV RUST_LOG=info
13EXPOSE 3000
14 
15CMD ["fullstack-app"]

Shuttle.rs Deployment

src/main.rsrust
1use shuttle_axum::ShuttleAxum;
2 
3#[shuttle_runtime::main]
4async fn main() -> ShuttleAxum {
5    let router = create_router().await;
6    Ok(router.into())
7}
8 
9// Deploy with:
10// cargo shuttle deploy

Performance Tips

  • Use memoization: create_memo for expensive computations
  • Lazy loading: Split code with dynamic imports
  • Resource pooling: Reuse database connections
  • Caching: Cache server function results when appropriate
  • Streaming SSR: Stream HTML for faster Time to First Byte
1// Streaming SSR example
2use philjs_axum::ResponseOptions;
3 
4#[component]
5pub fn StreamingApp() -> impl IntoView {
6    view! {
7        <Suspense fallback=|| view! { <p>"Loading..."</p> }>
8            <AsyncContent/>
9        </Suspense>
10    }
11}
12 
13#[component]
14async fn AsyncContent() -> impl IntoView {
15    let data = fetch_data().await;
16    view! { <div>{data}</div> }
17}

Testing

src/tests.rsrust
1#[cfg(test)]
2mod tests {
3    use super::*;
4    use philjs::testing::*;
5 
6    #[test]
7    fn test_counter() {
8        let runtime = create_runtime();
9 
10        runtime.run(|| {
11            let (count, set_count) = create_signal(0);
12 
13            assert_eq!(count.get(), 0);
14            set_count.set(5);
15            assert_eq!(count.get(), 5);
16        });
17    }
18 
19    #[tokio::test]
20    async fn test_server_function() {
21        let result = create_todo("Test".to_string()).await;
22        assert!(result.is_ok());
23    }
24}
